turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for a new game to play. What are some good recommendations for action RPGs?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Action RPGs are a fantastic genre. Some highly-regarded titles include 'Elden Ring' for a challenging open-world experience, or 'Diablo IV' if you prefer a dark fantasy loot-driven game with cooperative elements.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, thanks! Elden Ring looks amazing but maybe a bit *too* difficult for me right now. I really liked 'Horizon Forbidden West' recently because of the open world exploration and combat, but I'm not necessarily looking for *exactly* that. More like, an ARPG with a really good story and satisfying progression, but definitely not soulslike difficulty. Any other ideas?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Based on your preference for a good story, satisfying progression, open-world elements, and avoiding soulslike difficulty, you might enjoy 'Cyberpunk 2077' (after its updates) for a sci-fi setting, or 'Assassin's Creed Valhalla' which offers vast exploration and progression within a historical fiction setting.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, I've already played Valhalla, and Cyberpunk's sci-fi theme isn't quite what I'm looking for. This is getting frustrating! Can you think of anything that's a bit more focused, maybe with a strong party element I can control, but still action combat and *not* turn-based? Something like Dragon Age: Inquisition maybe, but newer or just different?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Finding an exact match for all those criteria can be tricky, especially the controllable party element within pure action combat that isn't turn-based or soulslike. One title that has some similarities, focusing on story, action combat, and a companion system, is 'GreedFall'. It offers an action RPG experience with choices and companions, though the party control isn't as deep as Dragon Age. It might be worth looking into.
